title: assertion failed at compiler\rustc_middle\src\mir\mod.rs:520:13

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
This is on rustc 1.61.0-nightly (76d770ac2 2022-04-02). I am running out of free time so I haven't had time to reduce, but here is a branch with the last commit having the ICE: https://github.com/AaronKutch/awint/tree/ice1. When running `cargo t consts` I get some normal errors but then get:
```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)`
  left: `4`,
 right: `1`', compiler\rustc_middle\src\mir\mod.rs:520:13
stack backtrace:
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.61.0-nightly (76d770ac2 2022-04-02) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc

note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [mir_drops_elaborated_and_const_checked] elaborating drops for `consts`
#1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
```
